title: Roaming Supports Item Idea!
body:
I got inspired by this video [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YJ1_HIllXfo) to make this post. I recommend watching it. 

Currently League has very little strategic diversity, ADC are always ranged, mid laners have burst, top laners are tanky etc. The 2 most strategically diverse roles right now are support and jungle. I think it's about time we had a new role.

Now the video I linked talks about Bard. Bard's passive was almost the game changer along with the introduction of scuttle crab, it could have been a support who roams for the laning phase and relies on, chimes + inspiration mastery to stay relevant in levels. This was too bold of a move apparently, so they just buffed his Q until he was viable. The true roaming support was almost a reality!

Therefore I want to introduce the roaming support item; **Ranger's Satchel**

Here is an image of the item.
https://i.imgur.com/QuhMXin.jpg

There would be 2 play styles for the roaming support:

1. Ward for the team, get scuttle control and vision on the jungler. In addition roamers like Bard can leave health packs for their junglers and laners.

2. Gank. This would be roamers like Alistar. They want to get level 2 as fast as possible and then gank.

Now if you look closely you can see that the item is useless in lane and is very cheap. The cheapness of the item allows the passive roamers to get up to 3 wards (including trinket) and 1 pot. It also allows aggressive roamers to get a ward + 3 pots, or any combination possible really.

The totems allow you to get triple experience, gold and movement speed on that side on the jungle. You can only capture them with Ranger's Satchel. Here's a map with where I think placement will be
http://i.imgur.com/euBTzwS.png

Ideas:

1. Roaming supports could allow for more ADC junglers. Think of a Bard always looking out and leaving health packs for his Vayne in the jungle.
2. Roaming supports could allow for 2 man invades into the enemy jungle, and more level 2 - 3 skirmishes.
3. Roaming supports could be a hard counter for champions like Lee Sin and Rek'Sai, by warding everything early.

Problems:

1. I don't want the duo bot meta to completely disappear! The roaming support item will have to be balanced very carefully to allow for both. It probably needs more drawbacks than it has currently.
2. The ganking power for roaming supports might be too strong. Especially if the enemy support is bot lane. Maybe lane items such as Doran's Ring, Blade and Shield will have to be given + [Mandrake Ward](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Mandrake_Ward). If this is done, then they need to implement a jungle camp buff that gives immunity to this vision.
3. Might get a little boring? I'd have to see it in action to know. Bard has his chimes mini-game going, but Alistar will just sit and heal between ganks. Maybe something else has to be added to make the players work for experience?

These are all ideas for Season 6, if you need me to clarify anything just ask! Please up vote so Riot sees this, and post some more ideas down below!

replies.body: The problem with this is, that Junglers would buy it and abuse it, since it gives double gold and XP on jungle camps, just be a WW and hit 6 before mid-lane even hits 3 and ult!
first quality post ive seen in 5 months
You would need to split this item or we will see another zohnyas ring

I'd be excited to a rammus solo bot lane + double jungle but some champs that scale with level more than gold can take this to squeeze out as much EXP from lane as possible, since this is the only item with EXP per second, and it's not even a unique passive!

You would have such a weak laning phase if you took this in lane. All stats are reduced by 1/3rd for 5 seconds when taking xp, so most of the time you would be getting 1.7 xp per 10 seconds. This gives no other lane stats too, no ad, no ap, no health, no armour, no regen etc.

A roaming mid or jungler can take this for the triple gold and experience from totems, especially if that mid laner is like me and takes boots as a starting item and still gets through fine even against targeted ability champions. 

As a mid, I'd practically have extra exp and the gold would pay itself out in 33 minutes if I stayed in lane only. If I was with the jungler and just stood on top of a captured totem all game for the triple bonus I'd have 330 gold in 3.6 minutes. This isn't even including the EXP and bonus counter jungling gold. Even without the 3x bonus I'd pay it out for 11 minutes.

A jungler on average would have 15 gold per 10 by taking this item compared to the 7 gold per 10 from Spellthief's and Ancient Coin, which is a ton if they're powerful enough early game to counter jungle monsters worth more than 30 gold.

Finally, all of this stacks so I can have two of the item after taking machete or boots.

Looks like the range on totem experience will have to controlled so it doesn't reach lanes. I just had 4000 there as an estimate. I think jungling with this item would be very dangerous, jungle monsters are pretty strong early with the Season 5 buffs.

Arggg I forgot to add unique passive :D
Oh my bad! This is a typo
The idea to take this in lane would be that you get a cheesy level and use that to get a cheesy kill, which grants double EXP/Gold
365 gold, like all other lv 1 sup items, then it should have 2 evolutions
I like the idea. The experience boost might become abusable in lane e.g get level 2 first and all in too win lane.

Double jungle and only take the small minions all in a batch where possible.

This keeps the main stats up high for longer.

As a note, it could just be taken for a cheesy early level 2 for a normal support

Great for counter jungling based junglers though.
bit op, im sure junglers might want it

They'll be missing out on the bonus gold their own item gives if they do. Although it should definitely not be possible to buy Ranger's Satchel and another starting item, just to make sure. Thanks for the comment btw

Double gold on an enemy camp can sometimes be better than +30 gold in all camps later on, so for champs that either counter jungle a ton or take the purple smite because they're a mage, then definitely this would be better.
Just reviewing this, I may have overshot on the gold per 10. I did some weird calculations, it should be something closer to 2 or 3 per 10.
